data.text: @dave_andersen I'm on light duty during medical rehab, I'd be happy to poke at it if that'd be helpful (but it often isn't I know!!) No big deal anyhow :) but let me know if I can help.

@Exercise4Reader It's not frozen nor is it specific to the truncated graph. Could be an error in the data source or could be that I'm doing something wrong in the way I'm parsing it. For now, I'm eliding that report until I figure it out. Something's broken.
@dave_andersen Clearly this is the Important Question of our time. :) Feel free to WONTFIX, I feel goofy reporting issues this way!
@Exercise4Reader Maybe. Will check when I get home.

@dave_andersen Is it possible the truncated graph is also frozen in time? The scale on the right hand side suggests it's still around 100 while the other graphs have a longer tail downward (thank goodness)?
@umassgym Slight increase in the number of covid+ patients in the ICU
@dave_andersen Are increased ICU numbers COVID+ or just total number of ICU patients?
